NC police charge teen with counterfeiting cash
Published 07:21 a.m., Friday, February 10, 2012 Tweet Comments ( 0 ) Larger | Smaller Printable Version
Email This Georgia (default)
Verdana
Times New Roman
Arial Font
Recent Headlines
Texas lawmakers hear testimony on health care law
San Antonio drive-thru worker gets prison for porn
Highland Park police seek what prompted stabbings
Texas police captain charged with indecency, girl
Group makes $1.5m ad buy against Dewhurst
Page 1 of 1 CONOVER, N.C. (AP) — Police in two western North Carolina towns have charged an 18-year-old in an ongoing probe of counterfeit cash in Catawba County.
The Hickory Daily Record reports ( http://bit.ly/wjLBev ) that Devin Andrew Yancey of Conover has been charged by police in his hometown and in nearby Newton.
Police in Conover have collected at least 25 counterfeit bills since January, while police in Hickory have found more than three dozen. Bogus cash has also been passed in Newton.
Conover police charged Yancey after questioning a customer who tried to pass a fake bill at a fast food restaurant. A separate incident led to Yancey being questioned by Newton police, who say they found bogus $20 bills in his backpack.
It couldn't be immediately determined if Yancey has a lawyer.
___
Information from: The Hickory Daily Record, http://www.hickoryrecord.com Printable Version Email This Tweet Subscribe to the San Antonio Express-News and receive access to the San Antonio Express-News for iPad App NC police charge teen with counterfeiting cash CONOVER, N.C.
